idealGrowingConditions.temperature: The optimal temperature for rice growth is between 20°C and 35°C.
idealGrowingConditions.soilType: Rice thrives in clay or loamy soil with high water retention capacity.
idealGrowingConditions.rainfall: Rice requires an average rainfall of 150 to 200 mm, making it ideal for regions with high humidity and seasonal rainfall.

plantingTime.sowingSeason: Rice is best planted during the monsoon season, from June to August.
plantingTime.harvestingTime: Rice can be harvested 90 to 120 days after sowing, depending on the variety.

waterRequirements: Rice is a water-intensive crop, requiring continuous water flooding during its vegetative stage.
expectedYield: The average yield of rice is 4 to 6 tons per hectare, depending on soil fertility and water availability.

pestControl.commonPests: Common pests include the rice stem borer and brown planthopper.
pestControl.controlMethods: Control methods include using neem-based pesticides or rotating crops to reduce pest infestation.

sustainabilityReason: Sustainable rice farming practices help preserve water resources and improve soil health, ensuring long-term productivity while minimizing environmental impact.

idealGrowingConditions.temperature: The ideal temperature for maize growth is between 20°C and 30°C.
idealGrowingConditions.soilType: Maize prefers well-drained, fertile soils with good organic matter.
idealGrowingConditions.rainfall: Maize requires about 500 to 800 mm of rainfall during the growing season.

plantingTime.sowingSeason: Maize is typically sown in early spring or late winter.
plantingTime.harvestingTime: Maize is usually harvested 90 to 100 days after sowing.

waterRequirements: Maize requires adequate moisture, especially during flowering and grain filling stages.
expectedYield: The average yield of maize can range from 4 to 10 tons per hectare based on management practices.

pestControl.commonPests: Common pests include the European corn borer and rootworm.
pestControl.controlMethods: Control methods include crop rotation and the use of pest-resistant maize varieties.

sustainabilityReason: Sustainable maize production practices enhance biodiversity, reduce soil erosion, and promote sustainable use of natural resources.

idealGrowingConditions.temperature: Chickpeas grow best in temperatures between 20°C and 30°C.
idealGrowingConditions.soilType: Chickpeas thrive in well-drained sandy or loamy soils with good fertility.
idealGrowingConditions.rainfall: Chickpeas require 300 to 600 mm of rainfall annually.

plantingTime.sowingSeason: Sow chickpeas in late winter to early spring.
plantingTime.harvestingTime: Harvest chickpeas about 100 to 120 days after sowing.

waterRequirements: Chickpeas are drought-tolerant but require adequate moisture during flowering and pod development.
expectedYield: Average yields range from 0.5 to 2 tons per hectare, depending on conditions.

pestControl.commonPests: Common pests include aphids and pod borers.
pestControl.controlMethods: Control methods include using insect-resistant varieties and crop rotation.

sustainabilityReason: Sustainable chickpea farming contributes to soil health through nitrogen fixation and helps in water conservation.

idealGrowingConditions.temperature: Kidney beans grow well in temperatures between 15°C and 30°C.
idealGrowingConditions.soilType: They prefer well-drained sandy or loamy soils rich in organic matter.
idealGrowingConditions.rainfall: Kidney beans require about 500 to 600 mm of rainfall during the growing season.

plantingTime.sowingSeason: Sow kidney beans in spring after the last frost.
plantingTime.harvestingTime: Harvest kidney beans about 90 to 120 days after planting.

waterRequirements: Adequate moisture is required during germination and flowering stages.
expectedYield: Average yields can range from 1 to 3 tons per hectare.

pestControl.commonPests: Common pests include aphids and beetles.
pestControl.controlMethods: Utilizing resistant varieties and crop rotation can help manage pests.

sustainabilityReason: Sustainable kidney bean cultivation promotes crop rotation and enhances soil health.

idealGrowingConditions.temperature: The ideal temperature for pigeon peas is between 20°C and 35°C.
idealGrowingConditions.soilType: Pigeon peas thrive in well-drained sandy or loamy soils.
idealGrowingConditions.rainfall: They require about 600 to 1,000 mm of rainfall annually.

plantingTime.sowingSeason: Sow pigeon peas at the beginning of the rainy season.
plantingTime.harvestingTime: Harvest after about 120 to 180 days.

waterRequirements: They are drought-resistant but need adequate moisture during flowering.
expectedYield: Average yield is around 0.5 to 1 ton per hectare.

pestControl.commonPests: Common pests include pod borers and aphids.
pestControl.controlMethods: Intercropping and using resistant varieties are effective control methods.

sustainabilityReason: Sustainable pigeon pea farming improves soil fertility and promotes biodiversity.

idealGrowingConditions.temperature: Moth beans grow best in temperatures ranging from 20°C to 35°C.
idealGrowingConditions.soilType: They thrive in sandy or gravelly soils with good drainage.
idealGrowingConditions.rainfall: Moth beans require about 400 to 600 mm of rainfall annually.

plantingTime.sowingSeason: Sow moth beans in spring.
plantingTime.harvestingTime: Harvest after about 70 to 90 days.

waterRequirements: They are drought-tolerant and require less water than other legumes.
expectedYield: Average yields are about 0.5 to 1 ton per hectare.

pestControl.commonPests: Common pests include aphids and caterpillars.
pestControl.controlMethods: Manual removal and neem-based pesticides are effective.

sustainabilityReason: Sustainable moth bean cultivation contributes to soil health and requires less water.

idealGrowingConditions.temperature: Mung beans grow best in temperatures between 20°C and 35°C.
idealGrowingConditions.soilType: They prefer well-drained, sandy or loamy soils.
idealGrowingConditions.rainfall: Mung beans require about 600 to 1,200 mm of rainfall annually.

plantingTime.sowingSeason: Sow mung beans in spring or summer.
plantingTime.harvestingTime: Harvest after about 60 to 80 days.

waterRequirements: Mung beans need adequate moisture, especially during flowering.

pestControl.commonPests: Common pests include aphids and thrips.
pestControl.controlMethods: Intercropping and organic pest control methods are effective.

sustainabilityReason: Sustainable mung bean farming improves soil fertility and enhances biodiversity.

idealGrowingConditions.temperature: Black gram grows best in temperatures ranging from 20°C to 35°C.
idealGrowingConditions.soilType: They prefer well-drained, sandy or loamy soils.
idealGrowingConditions.rainfall: Black gram requires about 600 to 1,200 mm of rainfall annually.

plantingTime.sowingSeason: Sow black gram in the kharif season.
plantingTime.harvestingTime: Harvest after about 70 to 90 days.

pestControl.commonPests: Common pests include aphids and caterpillars.
pestControl.controlMethods: Using organic pest control and resistant varieties can be effective.

sustainabilityReason: Sustainable black gram farming promotes soil health and nitrogen fixation.

idealGrowingConditions.temperature: Lentils thrive in temperatures between 15°C and 25°C.
idealGrowingConditions.soilType: They prefer well-drained, fertile soils.
idealGrowingConditions.rainfall: Lentils require about 300 to 600 mm of rainfall annually.

plantingTime.sowingSeason: Sow lentils in early spring.
plantingTime.harvestingTime: Harvest after about 90 to 110 days.

waterRequirements: Lentils are drought-tolerant but need moisture during germination.
expectedYield: Average yields range from 0.5 to 1.5 tons per hectare.

pestControl.commonPests: Common pests include aphids and weevils.
pestControl.controlMethods: Crop rotation and using resistant varieties are effective strategies.

sustainabilityReason: Sustainable lentil farming practices improve soil health and reduce reliance on chemical fertilizers.

idealGrowingConditions.temperature: Pomegranates thrive in temperatures between 20°C and 30°C.
idealGrowingConditions.soilType: They prefer well-drained sandy or loamy soils.
idealGrowingConditions.rainfall: Pomegranates require about 300 to 500 mm of rainfall annually.

plantingTime.sowingSeason: Sow pomegranate seeds in spring.
plantingTime.harvestingTime: Harvest after about 5 to 7 months.

waterRequirements: Pomegranates need regular watering, especially during dry spells.

pestControl.controlMethods: Using netting and organic pest control methods are effective.

idealGrowingConditions.rainfall: Bananas require about 1,500 to 2,000 mm of rainfall annually.

plantingTime.sowingSeason: Plant bananas year-round in suitable climates.

pestControl.commonPests: Common pests include banana weevils and aphids.
pestControl.controlMethods: Using organic pest control and resistant varieties are effective.

idealGrowingConditions.soilType: They prefer well-drained sandy or loamy soils.
idealGrowingConditions.rainfall: Mango trees require about 500 to 1,000 mm of rainfall annually.

plantingTime.sowingSeason: Mango seeds are best sown in spring.
plantingTime.harvestingTime: Harvest mangoes after about 3 to 5 months.

waterRequirements: Mango trees need adequate moisture during flowering and fruit development.
